bibl.title: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to J. F. Siler, February 24, 1954

div1.p: Nogueira thanks Siler for a check covering the expenses of the Finlay Medals.

div1.head: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to J. F. Siler, February 24, 1954
div1.opener:
DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
MEDICO CIRUJANO
MARTI 219, MARIANAO
-----
TELEFONO: B0-7577
Marianao February 24 of 1954
Joseph. F. Siler, Col (MC), U.S.A. Rtd.
President, Board of Managers Walter Reed
Memorial Association.-
Room 807, 1835 Eye St, N.W.
Washington 6, D.C.-U.S.A.
Dear Dr Siler:
div1.p:
I received your kind letter, dated 10 actual month, as
well as Check number 250075, for amount $ 245.00, to cover expense
on medals Finlay Order the following persons:

Mayor Walter Reed; Brigadier General Albert Truby; Mrs Blossom
Reed; Mr Houston Lazear; Mrs W.D. Lazear Briggs; Mayor James Ca-
rroll and Mr James Handberry.

Meantime thanking you, for your words, that you dedicated to
me, in your letter relationed with the Lazear Camp, which you can
be sure owing principally too the eagerness of Dr Philip Hench, w
whom we have only helped.

I am writing today Dr Hench advising him, that the widow of
Dr Robert Cooke, will receive the medal too; which for some invo-
luntary cause forgot to comunicate you. However, I have ordered
to make her medal too, why I think that it, will be arranged by
us in some way.

Please accept my sincery expression for your great help, so
those persons could receive these medals, and their diploms, which
mailing them I will inform you about that opportunity.

closer.seg:
P.D.- I inform you that the exactly price for each medals is only
$ 34.00, and for that I have now $ 7.00 that we can using
to pay in part the medal for Mrs Cook; in other words we
needs only $ 27.00 to pay it.
Please excuse my English but Dr Hench know that is poor.
Dr Pedro Nogueira
COPY TO DR HENCH
Dr. Pedro Nogueira
Marti 219- Quemados
Marianao.- CUBA
